The function $f(x)=(\sin x) / x$ is not defined when $x=0$. Using a calculator (and remembering that, if $x \in \mathbb{R}, \sin x$ means the sine of the angle whose radian measure is $x$ ), we construct a table of values correct to eight decimal places. From the table at the left and the graph in Figure 6 we guess that
$$
\lim _{x \rightarrow 0} \frac{\sin x}{x}=1
$$

This guess is in fact correct, as will be proved in Chapter 3 using a geometric argument.
